title: Quiz 6: Feb 2020 Theory FQE
topicName: Computer Application in Health Care Collection
description: February 2020 Final Qualifying Examination Theory Paper for Computer Application in Health Care (Database Management).

questions.question: In database design, the stage where one gathers and lists all necessary fields for the database project is:
questions.explanation: This is the initial phase of identifying what needs to be stored.

questions.question: Which of the following fields in an Access database has a width of 8 bytes?
questions.explanation: Date/Time data types use 8 bytes of storage.

questions.question: A ____ name must be unique within a database.
questions.explanation: You cannot have two tables with the same name in one database.

questions.question: The key that uniquely identifies each record in database is called:
questions.explanation: The Primary Key ensures uniqueness for every row.

questions.question: A 'one to many' relationship between student and subject tables typically implies:

options.text: One student can have many subjects
One subject can have more students
Many subjects can have many students
Many students can have many subjects

questions.explanation: While often Many-to-Many in reality, in a 1:M context, it means one entity (Student) relates to multiple of the other (Subjects).

questions.question: A part of a database that stores only one type of data (e.g. only names) is a:
questions.explanation: A Field (column) holds one specific attribute type.

questions.question: Which of the following is generally NOT considered a structured database source?
questions.explanation: PowerPoint presentations are unstructured slides, not organized data records like the others.

questions.question: A collection of related records in a database is known as:
questions.explanation: In relational databases, records are grouped into Tables.

questions.question: Each record is constituted by a number of individual data items called:
questions.explanation: Records are made up of Fields.

questions.question: The complete information about one activity or entity in a database is called a:
questions.explanation: A record contains all the fields for one specific item.

questions.question: What field type will you select if you need to enter long text?
questions.explanation: Memo handles large amounts of text.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an MS Access database object?
questions.explanation: Worksheets are used in Excel, not Access.

questions.question: In which method do we NOT need to specify the field type and size when creating a new table?

options.text: Create table by entering data (Datasheet View)

questions.explanation: Datasheet view automatically assigns types based on input.

questions.question: The option that creates a drop-down list of values is:
questions.explanation: Lookup Wizard creates the drop-down (Combo Box).

questions.question: The maximum length of a short text field is:
questions.explanation: Standard short text limit.

questions.question: When we create or open an MS Access Database file (older versions), we get to:
questions.explanation: The Database Window was the main container in versions before Access 2007.

questions.question: Columns in MS Access table are also called:
questions.explanation: Columns are Fields.

questions.question: Which of the following describes a FORM in MS Access?

options.text: Is an input screen for viewing/entering data
Is used to make print out from Access tables
Is optional once we can just report
Is used for storing special data

questions.explanation: Forms provide a user-friendly interface for data entry.

questions.question: How can you create a query in MS Access?
questions.explanation: Access provides multiple ways to build queries.

questions.question: The size of a field with data type as Number cannot be (in standard options):
questions.explanation: Standard number bytes are 1, 2, 4, 8. 16 is specific to GUIDs/Decimal, often considered the outlier in simple number choice lists.
questions.hint: Not a power of 2 up to 8.

questions.question: You can edit a relationship already established between two tables by:

options.text: Right click of the relationship line and then choose edit relationship
Double click on the relationship line

questions.explanation: Both methods work to open the relationship dialog.

questions.question: Which one of the following is NOT a field type in MS Access?
questions.explanation: Lookup Wizard is a tool/helper, not a native data type storage format.

questions.question: Which of the following relationship 'types' cannot be applied in MS Access database?
questions.explanation: There is no 'Two by two' relationship type in relational theory.

questions.question: Which field type stores photos in MS Access?
questions.explanation: OLE Object (or Attachment in newer versions) stores binary files like photos.

questions.question: Which data type should we use for storing a few paragraphs of a report?
questions.explanation: Memo is for long text.

questions.question: In database, data is held in which object?
questions.explanation: Tables are the only objects that actually store data.

questions.question: Which of the following shows the final database results in a more presentable way for printing?
questions.explanation: Reports are formatted for presentation/printing.

questions.question: How many characters can you type in maximum while writing the field name?
questions.explanation: Access field names are limited to 64 characters.

questions.question: To sort records in a table, you can:
questions.explanation: Access provides multiple UI methods to sort data.

questions.question: Commands to gather/retrieve data from database are stored in:
questions.explanation: Queries store the instructions (SQL) to retrieve data.
